Content:
## Quickstart

Make sure that you have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment or in a .env file in the root of the project. You can get an API key by signing up at the [Anthropic Console keys page](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).

Simple use case that spawns an interactive chat prompt with the filesystem MCP server from CLI:
Translation:
## Guia R√°pido

Certifique-se de que voc√™ exportou `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` em seu ambiente ou em um arquivo .env na raiz do projeto. Voc√™ pode obter uma chave de API registrando-se na [p√°gina de chaves do Console Anthropic](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).

Caso de uso simples que inicia um prompt de chat interativo com o servidor MCP do sistema de arquivos via CLI:

RowTranslations.originContent: Make sure that you have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment or in a .env file in the root of the project. You can get an API key by signing up at the [Anthropic Console keys page](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Certifique-se de que voc√™ exportou `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` em seu ambiente ou em um arquivo .env na raiz do projeto. Voc√™ pode obter uma chave de API registrando-se na [p√°gina de chaves do Console Anthropic](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).

RowTranslations.originContent: Simple use case that spawns an interactive chat prompt with the filesystem MCP server from CLI:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Caso de uso simples que inicia um prompt de chat interativo com o servidor MCP do sistema de arquivos via CLI:

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /Users/$USER/Desktop"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /Users/$USER/Desktop"
```

Content:
This will open up a chat prompt that you can use to interact with the servers and chat with an LLM.

## Config

You can also just specify your claude_desktop_config.json (Mac):
Translation:
Isso abrir√° um prompt de chat que voc√™ pode usar para interagir com os servidores e conversar com um LLM.

## Configura√ß√£o

Voc√™ tamb√©m pode simplesmente especificar seu claude_desktop_config.json (Mac):

RowTranslations.originContent: This will open up a chat prompt that you can use to interact with the servers and chat with an LLM.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Isso abrir√° um prompt de chat que voc√™ pode usar para interagir com os servidores e conversar com um LLM.

RowTranslations.originContent: You can also just specify your claude_desktop_config.json (Mac):
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Voc√™ tamb√©m pode simplesmente especificar seu claude_desktop_config.json (Mac):

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json"
```

Content: Or (Windows):
Translation: Ou (Windows):

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "%APPDATA%\Claude\claude_desktop_config.json"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "%APPDATA%\Claude\claude_desktop_config.json"
```

Content:
## Web mode

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b7e8a648-8084-4955-8cdf-fc6eb141572e

You can also run mcp-chat in web mode by specifying the `--web` flag (make sure to have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment):
Translation:
## Web mode

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b7e8a648-8084-4955-8cdf-fc6eb141572e

You can also run mcp-chat in web mode by specifying the `--web` flag (make sure to have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment):

RowTranslations.originContent: You can also run mcp-chat in web mode by specifying the `--web` flag (make sure to have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment):
RowTranslations.translatedContent: You can also run mcp-chat in web mode by specifying the `--web` flag (make sure to have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment):

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --web
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --web
```

Content:
In web mode, you can start new chats, send messages to the model, and dynamically configure the mcp servers via the UI - no need to specify on the command line. In addition, chats created via the Web UI are saved to ~/.mcpchats/chats just like chats created via the CLI.

## Features

- [x] Run via CLI in interactive mode or directly pass prompts with `-p`
- [x] Web mode to chat with models via a web interface `--web`
- [x] Connect to any MCP server (JS, Python, Docker) in production or during development
- [x] Choose between models with `-m`
- [x] Customize system prompt with `--system`
- [x] Saves chat history with settings in `~/.mcpchat/chats` including web chats
- [x] Save and restore commands in `~/.mcpchat/history`
- [x] View tool call output and arguments directly in chat to help debug mcp servers

## CLI Usage

Run prompts via CLI with the `-p` flag:
Translation:
No modo web, voc√™ pode iniciar novos chats, enviar mensagens para o modelo e configurar dinamicamente os servidores mcp via interface gr√°fica - sem necessidade de especificar na linha de comando. Al√©m disso, os chats criados pela Web UI s√£o salvos em ~/.mcpchats/chats assim como os chats criados via CLI.

## Funcionalidades

- [x] Execute via CLI em modo interativo ou envie prompts diretamente com `-p`
- [x] Modo web para conversar com modelos via interface web `--web`
- [x] Conecte-se a qualquer servidor MCP (JS, Python, Docker) em produ√ß√£o ou durante o desenvolvimento
- [x] Escolha entre modelos com `-m`
- [x] Personalize o prompt do sistema com `--system`
- [x] Salva o hist√≥rico de chats com configura√ß√µes em `~/.mcpchat/chats`, incluindo chats web
- [x] Salve e restaure comandos em `~/.mcpchat/history`
- [x] Veja a sa√≠da e os argumentos das ferramentas diretamente no chat para ajudar a depurar servidores mcp

## Uso via CLI

Execute prompts via CLI com a flag `-p`:

In addition, chats created via the Web UI are saved to ~/.mcpchats/chats just like chats created via the CLI.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: No modo web, voc√™ pode iniciar novos chats, enviar mensagens para o modelo e configurar dinamicamente os servidores mcp via interface gr√°fica - sem necessidade de especificar na linha de comando. Al√©m disso, os chats criados pela Web UI s√£o salvos em ~/.mcpchats/chats assim como os chats criados via CLI.

```shell

```

Content:
This runs the prompt with the kubenertes mcp-server & exits after the response is received on stdout.

Choose a model to chat with via CLI with the `-m` flag:
Translation:
Isso executa o prompt com o mcp-server do kubernetes e encerra ap√≥s a resposta ser recebida no stdout.

Escolha um modelo para conversar via CLI usando a op√ß√£o `-m`:

RowTranslations.originContent: This runs the prompt with the kubenertes mcp-server & exits after the response is received on stdout.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Isso executa o prompt com o mcp-server do kubernetes e encerra ap√≥s a resposta ser recebida no stdout.

RowTranslations.originContent: Choose a model to chat with via CLI with the `-m` flag:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Escolha um modelo para conversar via CLI usando a op√ß√£o `-m`:

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -m "claude-3.5"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -m "claude-3.5"
```

Content:
Uses the model `claude-3.5` to chat with. Note that currently only Anthropic models are supported.

Custom system prompt:

`--system` flag can be used to specify a system prompt:
Translation:
Utiliza o modelo `claude-3.5` para conversar. Observe que atualmente apenas modelos da Anthropic s√£o suportados.

Prompt de sistema personalizado:

O par√¢metro `--system` pode ser usado para especificar um prompt de sistema:

RowTranslations.originContent: Uses the model `claude-3.5` to chat with. Note that currently only Anthropic models are supported.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Utiliza o modelo `claude-3.5` para conversar. Observe que atualmente apenas modelos da Anthropic s√£o suportados.

RowTranslations.originContent: `--system` flag can be used to specify a system prompt:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: O par√¢metro `--system` pode ser usado para especificar um prompt de sistema:

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --system "Explain the output to the user in pirate speak." --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```

```shell

```

Content:
## ENV vars

Mcp-chat supports passing through env vars to mcp servers. This is not standardized in the mcp spec though and other clients may not do this with dynamic env var values - read more [here](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-server-kubernetes/issues/148#issuecomment-2950181666) about standard stdio mcp clients.
Translation:
## Vari√°veis de ambiente (ENV vars)

O Mcp-chat suporta o repasse de vari√°veis de ambiente para servidores MCP. No entanto, isso n√£o √© padronizado na especifica√ß√£o MCP e outros clientes podem n√£o utilizar valores din√¢micos de vari√°veis de ambiente ‚Äî leia mais [aqui](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-server-kubernetes/issues/148#issuecomment-2950181666) sobre clientes MCP padr√£o stdio.

RowTranslations.originContent: Mcp-chat supports passing through env vars to mcp servers. This is not standardized in the mcp spec though and other clients may not do this with dynamic env var values - read more [here](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-server-kubernetes/issues/148#issuecomment-2950181666) about standard stdio mcp clients.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: O Mcp-chat suporta o repasse de vari√°veis de ambiente para servidores MCP. No entanto, isso n√£o √© padronizado na especifica√ß√£o MCP e outros clientes podem n√£o utilizar valores din√¢micos de vari√°veis de ambiente ‚Äî leia mais [aqui](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-server-kubernetes/issues/148#issuecomment-2950181666) sobre clientes MCP padr√£o stdio.

Content:
```shell
KUBECONFIG="~/.kube/config" npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes"
```
Translation:
```shell
KUBECONFIG="~/.kube/config" npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes"
```

Content:
## For developers of mcp-servers

You can pass in a local build of a python or node mcp-server to test it out with mcp-chat:

Node JS:
Translation:
## Para desenvolvedores de mcp-servers

Voc√™ pode fornecer uma vers√£o local de um servidor mcp em Python ou Node para test√°-lo com o mcp-chat:

Node JS:

RowTranslations.originContent: You can pass in a local build of a python or node mcp-server to test it out with mcp-chat:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Voc√™ pode fornecer uma vers√£o local de um servidor mcp em Python ou Node para test√°-lo com o mcp-chat:

Content:
```shell
# Directly executing built script
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
# Using node / bun
npx mcp-chat --server "node /path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
```
Translation:
```shell
# Directly executing built script
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
# Using node / bun
npx mcp-chat --server "node /path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
```

Content: Python:
Translation: Python:

Content:
```shell
# Python: Using uv
npx mcp-chat --server "uv --directory /path/to/mcp-server-weather/ run weather.py"
# Using python / python3 - make sure to run in venv or install deps globally
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-weather/weather.py"
```
Translation:
```shell
# Python: Using uv
npx mcp-chat --server "uv --directory /path/to/mcp-server-weather/ run weather.py"
# Using python / python3 - make sure to run in venv or install deps globally
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-weather/weather.py"
```

RowTranslations.originContent: # Using python / python3 - make sure to run in venv or install deps globally
RowTranslations.translatedContent: # Using python / python3 - make sure to run in venv or install deps globally

Content:
## Development

Install dependencies & run the CLI:
Translation:
## Desenvolvimento

Instale as depend√™ncias e execute o CLI:

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Instale as depend√™ncias e execute o CLI:

Content:
```shell
git clone https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat
bun install
bun run dev
```
Translation:
```shell
git clone https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat
bun install
bun run dev
```

Content: To develop mcp-chat while connecting to an mcp-server, make a build & run the CLI with the server flag:
Translation: Para desenvolver mcp-chat enquanto se conecta a um mcp-server, fa√ßa uma build e execute o CLI com a flag de servidor:

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Para desenvolver mcp-chat enquanto se conecta a um mcp-server, fa√ßa uma build e execute o CLI com a flag de servidor:

RowTranslations.originContent: To develop mcp-chat while connecting to an mcp-server, make a build & run the CLI with the server flag:

Content:
```shell
npm run build && node dist/index.js --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```
Translation:
```shell
npm run build && node dist/index.js --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```

Content:
## Publishing new release

Go to the [releases](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/releases) page, click on "Draft New Release", click "Choose a tag" and create a new tag by typing out a new version number using "v{major}.{minor}.{patch}" semver format. Then, write a release title "Release v{major}.{minor}.{patch}" and description / changelog if necessary and click "Publish Release".

This will create a new tag which will trigger a new release build via the cd.yml workflow. Once successful, the new release will be published to npm. Note that there is no need to update the package.json version manually, as the workflow will automatically update the version number in the package.json file & push a commit to main.

## License

[MIT License](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/blob/main/LICENSE)
Translation:
## Publicando nova vers√£o

V√° para a p√°gina de [releases](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/releases), clique em "Draft New Release", clique em "Choose a tag" e crie uma nova tag digitando um novo n√∫mero de vers√£o usando o formato semver "v{major}.{minor}.{patch}". Em seguida, escreva um t√≠tulo para o release "Release v{major}.{minor}.{patch}" e uma descri√ß√£o / changelog se necess√°rio e clique em "Publish Release".

Isso criar√° uma nova tag que ir√° acionar uma nova build de release via o workflow cd.yml. Ap√≥s ser bem-sucedido, o novo release ser√° publicado no npm. Note que n√£o √© necess√°rio atualizar manualmente a vers√£o do package.json, pois o workflow ir√° atualizar automaticamente o n√∫mero da vers√£o no arquivo package.json e enviar um commit para main.

## Licen√ßa

[Licen√ßa MIT](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/blob/main/LICENSE)

Then, write a release title "Release v{major}.{minor}.{patch}" and description / changelog if necessary and click "Publish Release".
